com.krab.lazy

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.krab.lazy.Input

  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    Static wrapper for a utility class that keeps track of all currently pressed keys to simplify the code for complex keyboard interaction, because Processing doesn't offer that. Ask it for individual key states using chars or keyCodes and see if the key was pressed this frame, whether it is now down or whether it was just released. Also includes two simple mouse position functions. Mouse events are considered well-supported by Processing so there is no alternative offered here.

    • Method Detail

      • getChar

        public static KeyState getChar(java.lang.Character key)
        Get the current keyboard button state by using its char value. Meant to be used like getChar('n').down
        Parameters:
        key - char representation of the key
        Returns:
        current state of the keyboard button

      • getCode

        public static KeyState getCode(int keyCode)
        Get the current keyboard button state by using its keyCode value. Meant to be used like getCode(LEFT).down
        Parameters:
        keyCode - keyCode representation of the key
        Returns:
        current state of the keyboard button

      • getAllDownChars

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllDownChars()
        Gets all currently pressed chars as lowercase strings in a list. Does not include special keys for which key == CODED is true like CTRL and DELETE. The list is sorted in alphabetical order.
        Returns:
        list of all currently pressed chars as lowercase strings in a list
        See Also:
        processing key reference page, Processing keyCode reference

      • getAllDownCodes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getAllDownCodes()
        Gets all currently pressed keys as integer keyCodes in a list. Includes all standard chars as well as special keys like CTRL and DELETE, which you can compare with processing constants or com.jogamp.newt.event.KeyEvent int constants. The list is sorted in natural ascending order.
        Returns:
        list of all currently pressed keys as integer keyCodes
        See Also:
        processing keyCode reference page

      • debugPrintKeyEvents

        public static void debugPrintKeyEvents(boolean shouldDebugKeys)
        Prints all newly received key events to console when this is set to true until manually set to false. False by default to not clutter the console.
        Parameters:
        shouldDebugKeys - should the InputWatcher print all the key events it receives to console?

      • mousePos

        public static processing.core.PVector mousePos()
        Get the current mouseX and mouseY as a PVector.
        Returns:
        a PVector with the current mouse position

      • mousePosLastFrame

        public static processing.core.PVector mousePosLastFrame()
        Get pmouseX and pmouseY as a PVector describing the last frame's mouse position. This vector plus mouseDelta() should equal the current mousePos()
        Returns:
        a PVector with the previous frame's mouse position

      • mouseDelta

        public static processing.core.PVector mouseDelta()
        Gets the difference between current frame mouse position and previous frame mouse position as a PVector. This is equivalent to new PVector(app.mouseX - app.pmouseX, app.mouseY - app.pmouseY);
        Returns:
        a PVector with the difference between the last known mouse position and the current one
